Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy and is growing when it has enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant that looks wilted or not growing well without enough water.
The student can draw a plant that looks wilted or not growing well without enough light.
The student can use different colors or labels in their drawing to show areas that have light and areas that do not.
The student can demonstrate through their drawings that plants need water and light to live and grow.
The student can show patterns in their drawings, such as comparing a healthy plant with a plant without water or light.
